Detailed Description

The list that have the route-items (objects of the ExpandRouteLink class).

This list have the possibility to filter the route description in some different ways by looping over the Links. It can also save the route-items into a packet.

Member Function Documentation

void ExpandRouteHead::concatinateLinks (  ExpandRouteLink *  masterLink,
bool  after = true
) 
 

Concatinate two links into one.

The one given as parameter must be the one that have the turndescription that will be used after the concatination. { { NB!} One link is removed from the list and could therefore not be used anymore!}.

Parameters:
masterLink The link that will be left in the list, but with updated memebers.
after True if masterLink should be concatinated with the one that comes after, false it is should be concatinated with the one before.

int ExpandRouteHead::dump (   ) 
 

Returns:
The number of items in the list. A negative value is returned upon error.

int ExpandRouteHead::removeStreetsWithoutName (  uint32  maxDist  ) 
 

This method could be used to remove parts of the route without name when all route description items are inserted in the list.

Only no-names when driving straight ahead is removed.

Parameters:
maxDist The maximum length of the part without name that will be removed.
Returns:
The number of items removed. A negative value is returned upon error.

bool ExpandRouteHead::saveItemsPerStringIntoPacket (  ExpandRouteReplyPacket *  reply  ) 
 

Save the number of items per string in this route into a packet.

Note that this method must be called after saveStringDataIntoPacket() and after adding item data to the packet.

Parameters:
reply The packet where the items per string will be saved. saveStringDataIntoPacket() must be called before calling this method! Must be allocated before calling this method!
Returns:
True if the number of items per string is saved correctly into the packet, false otherwise.

bool ExpandRouteHead::saveStringDataIntoPacket (  ExpandRouteReplyPacket *  reply,
bool  triss
) 
 

Save the string data route-items in this route into a packet.

Parameters:
reply The packet where the route will be saved. Must be allocated before calling this method!
Returns:
True if the route is saved correctly into the packet, false otherwise.
